qas.question: hat years did the Spanish rule Guam?
What religion was the general population converted to?
Which two major holidays become popular in Guam?
What is the name of the modern Chamorro language?
What was pre-contact Chamorro cuisine based on?
What language did the Chamorro speak pre-contact?
In what year was the catalogo alfabetico de apellidos published?
In what year was the batu game created?
In what year was the chonka game created?

context: Post-European-contact Chamorro culture is a combination of American, Spanish, Filipino, other Micronesian Islander and Mexican traditions, with few remaining indigenous pre-Hispanic customs. These influences are manifested in the local language, music, dance, sea navigation, cuisine, fishing, games (such as batu, chonka, estuleks, and bayogu), songs and fashion. During Spanish colonial rule (<a0_0><b6_0><b7_0>1668<b7_0/><b6_0/>–<b8_0>1898<b8_0/><a0_0/>) the majority of the population was converted to <a1_0>Roman Catholicism<a1_0/> and religious festivities such as <a2_0>Easter and Christmas<a2_0/> became widespread. Post-contact Chamorro cuisine is largely based on <b4_0>corn<b4_0/>, and includes tortillas, tamales, atole and chilaquiles, which are a clear influence from Spanish trade between Mesoamerica and Asia. The modern Chamorro language is a <a3_0><b5_0>Malayo-Polynesian<b5_0/><a3_0/> language with much Spanish and Filipino influence. Many Chamorros also have Spanish surnames because of their conversion to Roman Catholic Christianity and the adoption of names from the Catálogo alfabético de apellidos, a phenomenon also common to the Philippines.
